Comments_List: I learned a lot of development economics theories and practices from Prof. Dan. His explanations were really understandable.
Theoretical microeconomic models on development. Papers reading.
I learnt a lot about different models and empirical works regarding development
Learned more about the theory and practice in development from various topics, and how researchers approach a question of interest
I learned about many empirical research papers that covered topics of Development Economics.
Development Economics Theory and empirical analysis
Learnt a few interesting empirical development papers.
Ease of access to research, will be comfortable understanding research in future
Chinas political system and social repercussions
It taught different aspects of economic research, what have the trends been and what were the lackings or strength of any research done till now.
More advanced understanding of theoretical models of development economics and how they have been applied in papers
Introduction to some ideas in development economics

Strength is well-organized course structure. He lectured a development theory on every Tuesday and its empirical approach on every Thursday, which is good.  
Weakness is we did not have much time to understand classes since the theories were advanced theories to some extent. Sometimes we did not follow the theories due to time constraint. Materials were not uploaded on canvas so that we could not catch up his classes.

I really like how the course introduced us to various models around development economics and also took us through empirical papers using some parts of those models. I feel that there was too much to learn in one class while we were doing the models because we weren't really walked through the model very thoroughly.

Strengths: the empirical aspect was very interesting. I liked how Dan tries to bring in different papers and show us interesting findings 
Weakness: the theory part was a bit dry.

The topics were very interesting. The choice of papers was very good and it had a very applied focus which I really liked. 
The program of the course in terms of problem sets and quizzes was not followed 100%.
The feedback to the draft research paper was really helpful.

The strengths are the Research Paper and the empirical classes.
The weaknesses are the theoretical classes, since they were too abstract.
Very extensive cover of the development economics issues, however, the theory part can be improved so students are not just copying the notes

Strengths:
Dan Keniston is an extremely smart professor.
He made us do a proposal for our research paper which was massively useful.

Weaknesses:
There needs to be higher level of engagement with the students from the professors.

Strength: lots of material covered. Great that we had to write a paper proposal.

Weakness: not always clear how each week was connected and where things were going
It was interactive but the discussion could have been better guided
More interesting mix of theory and application
Complete lack of effort on the part of the professor
Yes, if students who are interested in development, I definitely recommend taking the class
Yes if the student has some stats/econometrics background, and is interested in development
No I wouldn't recommend this course because the professor isn't up to mark. He focussed too much on things like risk and less on more interesting cutting edge development economics topics.
I would recommend it for students with not much knowledge in China
I would not recommend this professor
